sen.j: 清水谷家（しみずだにけ）は、羽林家の家格を有する公家。
sen.e: Shimizudani family was a kuge (court noble) with kakaku (family status) of urinke (the fourth highest family status for court nobles).
The Shimizudani family were kuge (court nobles) with kakaku (family status) of urinke (the fourth highest family status for court nobles).
The Shimizudani family were kuge (court nobles) with kakaku (family status) of urinke (the fourth highest family status for court nobles).
Kanin line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan
They came under the Kanin line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan
They came under the Kanin line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.
Ichimon of the Saionji family.
Ichimon of the Saionji family.
Ichimon of the Saionji family.

sen.j: 家業は書道、笙、能楽、神楽。
sen.e: Family businesses were
Family businesses were

Family businesses were calligraphy, sho (a wind instrument composed of a mouthpiece and seventeen bamboo pipes of various lengths), nogaku (the art of Noh) and Kagura (sacred music and dancing performed at shrine).
Itsu family crest is waribishi (four small diamonds forming a larger diamond).
The Itsu family crest was waribishi (four small diamonds forming a larger diamond).
Their kamon (family crest) was waribishi (four small diamonds forming a larger diamond).
Karoku (hereditary stipend) in the Edo Period was 200 koku (approx. 36.1 cubic meters).
Their Karoku (hereditary stipend) during the Edo Period was 200 koku (approx. 36.1 cubic meters).
Their Karoku (hereditary stipend) during the Edo period was 200 koku (approx. 36.1 cubic meters).
Count
They held the title Count
They held the title Count.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代、西園寺公経の二男一条実有を祖とする。
sen.e: The family was founded in the Kamakura Period by Saneari ICHIJO who was the second son of Kintsune SAIONJI.
sen.cmt: 「一条実有」の正しい読みは不明です。
sen.e: The family was founded during the Kamakura Period by Saneari ICHIJO, the second son of Kintsune SAIONJI.
The family was founded during the Kamakura period by Saneari ICHIJO, the second son of Kintsune SAIONJI.

sen.j: 当初は「一条家_(曖昧さ回避)」と名乗っていたが、一条実秋の代に一条家との重複を避けて現在の家名に改めたという。
sen.e: At first, the family named itself "Ichijo family (to avoid ambiguity),"but, when was the family head, the family name was changed to the present one to avoid duplication with the Ichijo family.
At first, the family named itself "Ichijo (to avoid ambiguity),"but, when it became the family head, the family name was changed to the present one to avoid duplication with the Ichijo family.
At first, the family named itself 'Ichijo (to avoid ambiguity),' but, when it became the family head, the family name was changed to the present one to avoid duplication with the Ichijo family.

sen.j: 後に一時期中絶していたが、江戸時代初期に再興した。
sen.e: The family was discontinued for a certain period but reestablished at the beginning of the Edo Period.
The family was discontinued for a certain period, but reestablished at the beginning of the Edo Period.
The family was discontinued for a certain period, but reestablished at the beginning of the Edo period.

sen.j: 清水谷実業は、歌道で有名な三条西家より養子に入り、霊元天皇歌壇の代表的歌人として知られる。
sen.e: Sanenari SHIMIZUDANI was adopted from the Sanjonishi family which was famous for waka poetry and was known as a representative kajin (waka poet) in the Emperor Reigen's waka circle.
Sanenari SHIMIZUDANI was adopted from the Sanjonishi family famous for waka poetry and was known as a representative kajin (waka poet) in Emperor Reigen's waka circle.
Sanenari SHIMIZUDANI was adopted from the Sanjonishi family famous for waka poetry and was known as a representative kajin (waka poet) in Emperor Reigen's waka circle.

sen.j: 幕末、明治維新期の清水谷公考（きんなる）は、明治維新後、箱館府知事に就任する。
sen.e: After Meiji Restoration, Kinnaru SHIMIZUDANI, who was the family head in the period of the end of the Edo period and Meiji Restoration, assumed the position of the Governor of the Hakodate-fu.
After the Meiji Restoration, Kinnaru SHIMIZUDANI, the family head near the end of the Edo period and Meiji Restoration, and assumed the position of the Governor of the Hakodate-fu.
After the Meiji Restoration, Kinnaru SHIMIZUDANI, the family head near the end of the Edo period and Meiji Restoration, and assumed the position of the Governor of the Hakodate-fu.

sen.j: 清水谷実英（さねあきら）は明治17年7月7日伯爵位を授けられ、宮中顧問官、掌典次長を務めた。
sen.e: The peerage of count was conferred on Saneakira SHIMIZUDAN on July 7, 1884 and he served as an imperial court councilor and shotenjicho (the deputy chief of shotenshoku, the section of the Imperial Household Agency handling the court ritual)

The peerage of count was conferred upon Saneakira SHIMIZUDAN on July 7, 1884 and he served as an imperial court councilor and shotenjicho (the deputy chief of shotenshoku, the section of the Imperial Household Agency handling the court rituals)

The peerage of count was conferred upon Saneakira SHIMIZUDANI on July 7, 1884 and he served as an imperial court councilor and shotenjicho (the deputy chief of shotenshoku, the section of the Imperial Household Agency handling the court rituals).
